required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Study of Combined Chemotherapy With Arsenic Trioxide in Stage 4/M Neuroblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Research on Efficacy and Safety of Combined Chemotherapy With Arsenic Trioxide in Stage 4/M Neuroblastoma：A Prospective，Single-arm, Open-label, Multi-center Study
clinical_study.source: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial aims to explore and evaluate the efficacy and safety of combined chemotherapy with arsenic trioxide for stage 4/M neuroblastoma.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, single-arm, open-lable, multi-center clinical trial. Children≤ 14 years old are eligible for this study if they were newly diagnosed with neuroblastoma and assessed as stage 4 according to the International Neuroblastoma Staging System (INSS) or stage M according to the International Neuroblastoma Risk Group (INRG) respectively. Patients enrolled in this study will receive combined induction chemotherapy with arsenic trioxide following an modifed protocol based on N7 and NB2004 protocols. Objective response rate (ORR) at 4 weeks after completing induction chemotherapy was defined as the main outcome and adverse events were monitored and graded in the meantime.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Combined induction chemotherapy with arsenic trioxide

primary_outcome.time_frame: Four weeks after ATO-combined induction chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of patients enrolled until the date of death from any cause，From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 3 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Survival time from patients diagnosed with stage 4/M neuroblastoma untill death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of patients enrolled to the date of of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 3 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Survival time from patients diagnosed with stage 4/M neuroblastoma untill disease progression or death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of ATO-combined chemotherapy until the date of first documented adverse event, and follow up for 3 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events are monitored and graded by the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI-CTCAE)

arm_group.description: Patients receive combined induction chemotherapy with arsenic trioxide.

intervention.description: Arsenic trioxide（ATO） is administered 0.16mg/kg per day over eight hours IV daily for ten days. Patients will receive ATO alone on days 1-2 and combined with conventional induction chemotherapy on days 3-10. Nine cycles at most of ATO-combined chemotherapy were applied in the whole scheme.

facility.name: Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital, Sun Yat-sen University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University
